meanings.definition: The stems or stalks of beans, peas, or potatoes.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the haulm to use as mulch in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The haulm from the peas was left in the field to decompose and enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the haulm as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The haulm stood tall in the field, like a forest of miniature trees.
meanings.sent5: The bright green haulm swayed gently in the breeze, creating a peaceful scene.

meanings.definition: To clear away by pulling or dragging.
meanings.sent1: The workers had to haulm the fallen branches to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: She had to haulm the heavy boxes out of the storage room.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to haulm the toys out of the closet for a game.
meanings.sent4: He had to haulm the old furniture out of the house to make space for the new.
meanings.sent5: The team had to haulm the debris from the construction site to keep it clean.
